column5: Hey guys I just returned from another remarkable trip to the Sutton river in Ontario's far north. In a word it was "speck"tacular.Literally hundreds of trophy class fish were caught, some swinging streamers but most were caught skating mouse patterns across the surface. Can't even begin to describe how awesome it was!The full story will be published early in 2015 in Ontario Out Of Doors magazine. Until then here's a link to a short teaser with a pretty cool video clip and a bunch of photos.Cheershttp://www.canadafishingguide.net/re...tton-a-teaser/
HI MIke - yep that is definitely a teaser report. Weigh any of the brookieslook like 4-6 pounds? Great photography (no trip this year) needed a Canada fix..
Thanks! Didn't weigh any, but we had lots over 5lb's no doubt about that. Don't think we broke 6, but I'm not complaining.
NICE, NICE, NICE!!! The native Brook trout in our area are my favorite fish. They aren't very big, but they sure are beautiful.

My gosh Mike, not only the beautiful fish but the whole setting including camp leave my mouth watering. Thanks for the "tease" and hope you can alert us when the full article is out. All I can say is WOW!
What a great adventure......thanks for sharing some of your trip!
looking forward to the full report!
